summary: Email chain discussing legal strategy in the Epstein case, including an agreement not to contest liability for certain victims, the involvement of Judge Davis as a decider, and coordination regarding discovery and subpoenas. The communication involves attorneys and a US Attorney.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Attorney involved in legal strategy discussions regarding the Epstein case, coordinating on discovery and subpoena matters.

persons.name: Acosta, Alex
persons.context: US Attorney copied on email discussing legal strategy and discovery in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Judge Davis
persons.context: Judge indicated as willing to serve as the 'decider' in the Epstein case, with discussions about his role and anticipated decision.

connections.description: Communicating about legal strategy, discovery, and subpoenas in the Epstein case, with Acosta copied on emails.
Lefkowitz references Judge Davis's willingness to serve as a decider in the case and follows up on his involvement.

events.title: Legal Agreement Addendum Execution
events.description: An executed version of an addendum related to the Epstein case is sent, with instructions to FedEx original signature pages.

events.title: Email Coordination on Epstein Case
events.description: Email chain discusses agreement not to contest liability for certain victims, Judge Davis's role as decider, and discovery/subpoena planning.

keyFacts: An agreement states that liability will not be contested for the girls on a specified list, focusing discovery on damages rather than veracity of claims.
Judge Davis is indicated as willing to serve as the 'decider' in the case, with follow-up planned to confirm his role and decision timeline.
Attorneys are coordinating on discovery and subpoena strategies, with assumptions that the US Attorney's office does not want to be copied on subpoenas.
The communication is marked as confidential and attorney-client privileged, originating from Kirkland & Ellis LLP.
